Job Details

New ideas are all around us, but only a few will change the world. That’s our focus at JPL. We ask the biggest questions, then search the universe for answers—literally. We build upon ideas that have guided generations, then share our discoveries to inspire generations to come. Your mission—your opportunity—is to seek out the answers that bring us one step closer. If you’re driven to discover, create, and inspire something that lasts a lifetime and beyond, you’re ready for JPL.

Located in Pasadena, California, JPL has a campus-like environment situated on 177 acres in the foothills of the San Gabriel Mountains and offers a work environment unlike any other: we inspire passion, foster innovation, build collaboration, and reward excellence.

Will:

  • Will be a remote Intern in the Sea Level and Ice (329C) Group and will report to the Group Supervisor.
  • Will be provided with hands-on experience in the field of sea-level change science, work experience in the application of remote sensing and modeling techniques to improve sea-level projections in the next 100 years, as well as work experience in computational frameworks relying on high-performance computing.
  • Will lead research tasks to develop new approaches/methods to research sea-level science, in particular as it relates to coastal processes, local geological processes controlling uplift, coastal migration, GIA, solid-Earth/Cryosphere interactions close to polar ice sheets, ice-sheet dynamics, terrestrial water storage evolution, sea-level fingerprints, ocean dynamics and steric sea-level.
  • Will provide technical support to research projects, programs or research laboratories in earth and computational sciences.
  • Performs routine job functions and activities within assigned area.
  • Assists with data analysis, technical analysis and/or fundamental research.
  • Receives guidance from advisor to modify scientific or technology development and test techniques, processes, and procedures.
  • Conducts scientific analysis of numerical experiments.
  • Performs scientific tasks in support of projects and/or programs.
  • Uses applicable policies, procedures and practices as guides to determine work methods and deliver results.
  • Seeks guidance in applying applicable policies, procedures and practices to new situations to determine appropriate action.
  • Interacts primarily with immediate supervisor and team members within own organization.

Required Skills:

  • Must be currently enrolled in a college or university pursuing a PhD in Geophysics, Applied Math, Physics, Computer Science or related technical discipline.
  • Must have at least 1 semester or quarter remaining to complete degree
  • Must be available to work remotely (10-20 hours/week) for the fall and spring semesters.
  • Must have a minimum cumulative 3.0 out of a 4.0 GPA or equivalent
  • Knowledge and experience with MS Office.
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills and ability to work in a team environment.

Desired Skills:

  • Experience in either Matlab/Python/JavaScript.
  • Experience in machine learning algorithms.
  • Programming language C++/Fortran/AppleScript
  • Understanding of Earth Sciences as it related to Sea-Level Change and Cryopshere changes.
  • Interest in sea-level rise projections.
  • Modeling or Remote Sensing skills.

The typical hourly rate for this job in Pasadena, California depending on education level is $43.

JPL has a catalog of benefits and perks that span from the traditional to the unique.
